intro: Catunaregam brandisii, commonly known as the Indian star anise. It is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent, particularly found in the Western Ghats and parts of southern India. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers and aromatic fruits that resemble those of the star anise. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is often grown for its medicinal properties. The leaves and fruits are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
